snippet: Nicholas A. Spano, a former legislator from Westchester County, planned to admit to failing to report more than $45,000 in income, his lawyer said.
abstract: Former New York State Senator Nicholas A Spano will plead guilty to a federal tax evasion charge; Spano failed to report more than $45,000 in income from 2000 to 2008 and could face 18 months in prison.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and DANNY HAKIM

lead_paragraph: Nicholas A. Spano, a former legislator from Westchester County, planned to admit to failing to report more than $45,000 in income, his lawyer said.

headline.seo: Nicholas Spano, Ex-Westchester Senator, Is to Plead Guilty
headline.main: Former State Senator From Westchester Is to Plead Guilty on a Federal Tax Charge
headline.print_headline: Former State Senator From Westchester Is to Plead Guilty on a Federal Tax Charge
